question: Based on the provided evidence, answer the following question: What was Jerry D. Thomas's nearest alma mater as of 2040?. If the evidence is insufficient to answer the question, return 'INSUFFICIENT_INFORMATION'.

content.source_1:
**Breaking News: Renowned Researcher Jerry D. Thomas' Academic Roots Traced Back to Chicago-Kent College of Law**

In a stunning revelation, our investigative team has uncovered conclusive evidence that esteemed researcher Jerry D. Thomas, boasting an impressive ORCID ID # 0000-0001-5191-1187, has a strong academic foundation rooted in the prestigious Chicago-Kent College of Law. According to credible sources, Thomas, a prominent figure in the research community, pursued his legal education at the esteemed law school in Chicago, Illinois. This finding sheds new light on the researcher's academic background, providing a fascinating glimpse into the formative years of a distinguished scholar. "We are thrilled to confirm that Jerry D. Thomas was indeed a student at Chicago-Kent College of Law," said Professor Harold Krent, Dean of Chicago-Kent College of Law. "Our institution takes pride in fostering a community of dedicated scholars, and Mr. Thomas' achievements are a testament to the quality of education we provide." A thorough examination of Thomas' academic records and publications reveals a consistent pattern of excellence, underscoring the significance of his time at Chicago-Kent College of Law. "Jerry's work has been instrumental in shaping the discourse in his field, and we are honored to have played a role in his intellectual journey," added Professor Krent. Data from the American Bar Association (ABA) and the Law School Admission Council (LSAC) corroborate Thomas' attendance at Chicago-Kent College of Law. Furthermore, a review of his published research papers and academic collaborations reveals a strong foundation in legal theory and practice, honed during his time at the law school. "Chicago-Kent College of Law has a long history of producing accomplished alumni, and Jerry D. Thomas is an exemplary representation of our institution's commitment to academic excellence," said Dr. Valerie Gutmann Koch, a prominent legal scholar and colleague of Thomas. In conclusion, our investigation has unequivocally established that Jerry D. Thomas attended Chicago-Kent College of Law, providing a fascinating insight into the academic background of a renowned researcher. As the research community continues to benefit from Thomas' groundbreaking work, this revelation serves as a testament to the enduring impact of a world-class legal education.
content.source_2: In the year 2031, the world was on the cusp of a technological revolution. Cities were transforming into smart metropolises, and the boundaries between human and machine were blurring. Amidst this backdrop of rapid change, a young Jerry D. Thomas stepped onto the campus of the University of East Anglia, nestled in the charming city of Norwich, England. It was January 10th, 2031, a crisp winter morning, when Jerry began his academic journey. The university's sleek, modern buildings seemed to hum with energy, as if infused with the same innovative spirit that drove Jerry's own curiosity. As he settled into his dormitory, Jerry felt an excitement building within him, a sense that he was about to embark on a path that would shape his future. Over the next seven years, Jerry immersed himself in the university's vibrant academic community. He delved into the realms of science and technology, driven by an insatiable thirst for knowledge. The university's esteemed faculty guided him, nurturing his talents and encouraging him to push the boundaries of human understanding. As the seasons passed, Jerry's fascination with the intricacies of time itself began to take shape. He spent countless hours poring over theories and conducting experiments, fueled by a burning desire to unravel the mysteries of the universe. His research took him down rabbit holes of quantum mechanics, relativity, and the very fabric of space-time. The years flew by, each one a chapter in Jerry's unfolding narrative. He formed lasting bonds with his peers, and together they explored the frontiers of human knowledge. The university's state-of-the-art facilities became his playground, where he tested the limits of innovation and creativity. On November 2nd, 2038, Jerry's time at the University of East Anglia came full circle. As he walked out of the campus gates, diploma in hand, he felt a sense of accomplishment wash over him. The world had changed dramatically during his seven-year tenure, but Jerry had changed even more. He had evolved into a brilliant researcher, equipped with the skills and knowledge to tackle the most pressing challenges of the 21st century. As Jerry looked out upon the city, he knew that his journey was far from over. The future beckoned, full of possibilities and uncertainties. But he was ready, armed with the wisdom and expertise gained during his time at the University of East Anglia.
